relations.target: Canada=08837973-n (a nation in northern North America; the French were the first Europeans to settle in mainland Canada; \""the border between the United States and Canada is the longest unguarded border in the world\""

gravy=07492727-n (a sudden happening that brings good fortune (as a sudden opportunity to make money); \""the demand for testing has created a boom for those unregulated laboratories where boxes of specimen jars are processed like an assembly line\"");07853888-n (the seasoned but not thickened juices that drip from cooking meats; often a little water is added);07854049-n (a sauce made by adding stock, flour, or other ingredients to the juice and fat that drips from cooking meats

curd=07865888-n (coagulated milk; used to make cheese; \""Little Miss Muffet sat on a tuffet eating some curds and whey\"");07866059-n (a coagulated liquid resembling milk curd; \""bean curd\""; \""lemon curd\""

cheese=01525792-v (wind onto a cheese; \""cheese the yarn\"");02686501-v (used in the imperative (get away, or stop it); \""Cheese it!\"");07866305-n (a solid food prepared from the pressed curd of milk);12192020-n (erect or decumbent Old World perennial with axillary clusters of rosy-purple flowers; introduced in United States
french fries=07726825-n (strips of potato fried in deep fat)

dish=00433821-n (an activity that you like or at which you are superior; \""chemistry is not my cup of tea\""; \""his bag now is learning to play golf\""; \""marriage was scarcely his dish\"");03211629-n (a piece of dishware normally used as a container for holding or serving food; \""we gave them a set of dishes for a wedding present\"");03212026-n (directional antenna consisting of a parabolic reflector for microwave or radio frequency radiation);07572999-n (a particular item of prepared food; \""she prepared a special dish for dinner\"");10633512-n (a very attractive or seductive looking woman);13789036-n (the quantity that a dish will hold; \""they served me a dish of rice\"");00264357-v (make concave; shape like a dish);01182648-v (provide (usually but not necessarily food); \""We serve meals for the homeless\""; \""She dished out the soup at 8 P.M.\""; \""The entertainers served up a lively show\""

senses.definition: A dish consisting of french fries topped with cheese curds and gravy, eaten primarily in Canad
